availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of B. Faris and A. B. Faris. Resident in Christian County in 1850. Private, corporal, and quartermaster sergeant in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from September 23, 1861, to June 3, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District One.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994050, Muhlenberg County Deaths.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319.
Find A Grave, “W. H. Farris (1840-1876)," Memorial #142663337, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/142663337 (accessed on May 22, 2018).
